page.title: 12THORNBURY CASTLE
page.content:
In 1510 the{Duke of Buckingham received permission from{Henry V111} to fortify and crenellate Thornbury Manor. Ten yers later he was executed for treason and his castle and lands were confiscated by the King.
Henry stayed with{Anne Boleyn}at the castle for a few days and later{Mary {Tudor}lived there for several years before becoming Queen. At this time the castle was returned to the Duke of Buckingham's descendants,the Howards. It is said that the Duke's headless ghost still haunts the buildings.
In 1966{Mr.K.Bell}bought and converted the castle into a 1st class restaurant and hotel with two dining rooms and 12 bedrooms. He has been responsible for the planting of 1,800 vines from which the castle produces its own wine.
